name: NOTION__GET_PAGE
description: Retrieves a Page object using the ID specified. Returns page properties (limited to 25 references per property) but not page content. For page content, use the Retrieve block children endpoint. For properties with >25 references, use the Retrieve a page property endpoint. If page's parent is a database, properties conform to database schema. If not, only title is available.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to retrieve.

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the page. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values. To retrieve multiple properties, specify each page property ID. For example: ?filter_properties=iAk8&filter_properties=b7dh.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__SEARCH_PAGES
description: Searches all pages that have been shared with an integration. Returns pages that have titles matching the query.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

query.description: The text to search for in page titles.

start_cursor.description: Cursor for pagination. If supplied, limits results to those after the cursor.

page_size.description: Number of results to return. Maximum: 100

name: NOTION__TOGGLE_PAGE_ARCHIVE
description: Archives or restores a page. Note: Cannot archive workspace-level pages via API, and the API does not support permanently deleting pages.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to archive or restore

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

archived.description: Set to true to archive the page, false to restore it from trash

name: NOTION__RESTORE_PAGE
description: Restores a page from trash.

page_id.description: The ID of the page to restore from trash

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

archived.description: Set to false to restore the page from trash

name: NOTION__LIST_USERS
description: Returns a paginated list of Users for the workspace. Does not include guests. Requires user information capabilities.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_USER
description: Retrieves a User using the ID specified. Requires user information capabilities.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_ME
description: Retrieves the bot User associated with the API token provided in the authorization header.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use. Defaults to 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__CREATE_PAGE
description: Creates a new page that is a child of an existing page or database. If the parent is a database, properties must match the parent database's schema.

Notion-Version.description: The version of the Notion API to use.

parent.description: The parent page or database where the new page will be created. Use EITHER database_id OR page_id, not both.

database_id.description: The ID of the database this page belongs to (for database entries)

page_id.description: The ID of the page this page belongs to (for child pages)

properties.description: Page properties. For child pages, typically only 'title' is needed. For database entries, properties must match the database schema. Title format: {'title': [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'Page Title'}}]}

title.description: Page title as rich text array. Format: [{'type': 'text', 'text': {'content': 'Title Text'}}]

children.description: Page content as an array of block objects. Common types: paragraph, heading_1, heading_2, heading_3, bulleted_list_item, numbered_list_item

paragraph.description: Paragraph block content. Use when type is 'paragraph'

external.description: External file details when type is 'external'

name: NOTION__CREATE_DATABASE
description: Creates a new database as a child of an existing page.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

parent.description: A page parent. Must contain a page_id key with the page UUID as the value.

page_id.description: The ID of the parent page where the database will be created

title.description: Title of database as it appears in Notion. An array of rich text objects.

content.description: The text content for the database title

properties.description: Property schema of database. The keys are the names of properties as they appear in Notion and the values are property schema objects. Each property value must include the property type (e.g., 'title': {}, 'rich_text': {}, 'number': {'format': 'dollar'}, etc.)

external.description: External file details when type is 'external'

name: NOTION__GET_DATABASE
description: Retrieves a database object using the ID specified.

database_id.description: An identifier for the Notion database

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__UPDATE_DATABASE
description: Updates the database object — the title, description, or properties — of a specified database.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

title.description: An array of rich text objects that represents the title of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database title remains unchanged.

description.description: An array of rich text objects that represents the description of the database that is displayed in the Notion UI. If omitted, then the database description remains unchanged.

properties.description: The properties of a database to be changed in the request. If updating an existing property, then the keys are the names or IDs of the properties as they appear in Notion, and the values are property schema objects. If adding a new property, then the key is the name of the new database property and the value is a property schema object. To remove a property, set the property object to null.

name: NOTION__QUERY_DATABASE
description: Gets a list of Pages contained in the database, filtered and ordered according to the filter conditions and sort criteria provided.

filter_properties.description: A list of page property value IDs associated with the database. Use this param to limit the response to a specific page property value or values for pages that meet the filter criteria.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

filter.description: When supplied, limits which pages are returned based on the filter conditions. Can be a property filter, compound filter with 'and'/'or' operators, or timestamp filter.

sorts.description: When supplied, orders the results based on the provided sort criteria. Can sort by property values or timestamps.

property.description: The name of the property to sort against

timestamp.description: The name of the timestamp to sort against

start_cursor.description: When supplied, returns a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

name: NOTION__APPEND_BLOCK_CHILDREN
description: Creates and appends new children blocks to the parent block_id specified. Blocks can be parented by other blocks, pages, or databases. Returns a paginated list of newly created first level children block objects.

block_id.description: Identifier for a block. Also accepts a page ID.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

children.description: Child content to append to a container block as an array of block objects. Common types: paragraph, heading_1, heading_2, heading_3, bulleted_list_item, numbered_list_item

paragraph.description: Paragraph block content. Use when type is 'paragraph'

heading_1.description: Heading 1 block content. Use when type is 'heading_1'

after.description: The ID of the existing block that the new block should be appended after.

name: NOTION__GET_BLOCK
description: Retrieves a Block object using the ID specified. If the block contains has_children: true, use Retrieve block children to get the list of children.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_BLOCK_CHILDREN
description: Returns a paginated array of child block objects contained in the block using the ID specified. In order to receive a complete representation of a block, you may need to recursively retrieve the block children of child blocks.

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__UPDATE_BLOCK
description: Updates the content for the specified block_id based on the block type. Supported fields based on the block object type. The update replaces the entire value for a given field.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

body.description: Block update parameters. Provide the block type-specific properties to update (e.g., paragraph, heading_1, etc.)

archived.description: Set to true to archive (delete) a block. Set to false to un-archive (restore) a block.

paragraph.description: Paragraph block content. Use when updating a paragraph block

heading_1.description: Heading 1 block content. Use when updating a heading_1 block

heading_2.description: Heading 2 block content. Use when updating a heading_2 block

heading_3.description: Heading 3 block content. Use when updating a heading_3 block

name: NOTION__DELETE_BLOCK
description: Sets a Block object, including page blocks, to archived: true using the ID specified. Note: in the Notion UI application, this moves the block to the 'Trash' where it can still be accessed and restored.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_PAGE_PROPERTY
description: Retrieves a page property item using the specified page ID and property ID. For paginated properties, returns a list of property item objects with pagination support.

page_size.description: For paginated properties. The max number of property item objects on a page. The default size is 100

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__UPDATE_PAGE_PROPERTIES
description: Updates the properties of a page in a database. The properties schema must match the parent database's properties. Can also update page icon, cover, and archive/restore pages.

page_id.description: The identifier for the Notion page to be updated.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

properties.description: The property values to update for the page. The keys are the names or IDs of the property and the values are property values. If a page property ID is not included, then it is not changed.

in_trash.description: Set to true to delete a block. Set to false to restore a block.

archived.description: Set to true to archive a page. Set to false to restore a page.

icon.description: A page icon for the page. Supported types are external file object or emoji object.

cover.description: A cover image for the page. Only external file objects are supported.

name: NOTION__CREATE_COMMENT
description: Creates a comment in a page or existing discussion thread. Either parent.page_id or discussion_id parameter must be provided (not both). Returns a comment object for the created comment.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

parent.description: A page parent object. Either this or a discussion_id is required (not both)

page_id.description: The ID of the page to comment on

discussion_id.description: A UUID identifier for a discussion thread. Either this or a parent object is required (not both)

rich_text.description: Rich text content array for the comment

attachments.description: An array of comment attachment requests

file_upload_id.description: The ID of the uploaded file

display_name.description: Custom display name of a comment

name: NOTION__GET_COMMENT
description: Retrieves a Comment object from its comment_id. Requires read comment capabilities to be enabled for the integration.

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.

name: NOTION__GET_COMMENTS
description: Retrieves a list of un-resolved Comment objects from a page or block. Supports pagination with cursor-based iteration. Requires read comment capabilities to be enabled for the integration.

block_id.description: Identifier for a Notion block or page

start_cursor.description: If supplied, this endpoint will return a page of results starting after the cursor provided. If not supplied, this endpoint will return the first page of results.

page_size.description: The number of items from the full list desired in the response. Maximum: 100

Notion-Version.description: The API version to use for this request. The latest version is 2022-06-28.
